title: Solomon's Wealth and Wisdom
shortSummary: This chapter highlights the visit of the queen of Sheba to Solomon, showcasing his unparalleled wisdom and wealth. It also details Solomon's riches, his extensive trade, and his reign over Israel, emphasizing God's blessing on Solomon's kingdom. The chapter concludes with Solomon’s death and succession by his son Rehoboam.

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel renowned for his wisdom, wealth, and building projects, including the temple in Jerusalem.

keyCharacters.name: Queen of Sheba
keyCharacters.description: A foreign monarch who visits Solomon to test his wisdom with difficult questions and is impressed by his wealth and God-given wisdom.

keyCharacters.name: Huram's servants
keyCharacters.description: Servants of Huram, the king of Tyre, who assist Solomon by bringing gold, algum trees, and precious stones.

keyCharacters.name: Rehoboam
keyCharacters.description: Son of Solomon who succeeds him as king of Israel after Solomon’s death.

outline.heading: The Queen of Sheba’s Visit and Test of Solomon’s Wisdom
outline.description: The queen of Sheba arrives in Jerusalem with gifts to test Solomon’s wisdom. After witnessing his wisdom and the splendor of his court, she praises God and acknowledges Solomon’s God-given wisdom.

outline.heading: Gifts and Solomon’s Generosity
outline.description: The queen of Sheba presents Solomon with lavish gifts, and Solomon reciprocates by giving her whatever she desires, demonstrating his wealth and generosity.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Wealth and Splendor
outline.description: A detailed account of Solomon’s immense wealth, including gold, precious stones, and luxurious items like golden shields and an ivory throne overlaid with gold.

outline.heading: Trade and International Relations
outline.description: Solomon’s ships engage in trade with distant lands, bringing valuable goods. Kings from around the world seek Solomon’s wisdom and bring him gifts.

outline.heading: Military Strength and Dominion
outline.description: Solomon’s military power is described with thousands of horses and chariots, and his reign extends over a vast territory from the Euphrates River to Egypt.

outline.heading: Solomon’s Death and Succession
outline.description: The chapter concludes by referencing other records of Solomon’s reign and noting his forty-year rule, his death, burial, and the succession of his son Rehoboam.

application: Seek God’s wisdom earnestly, trusting that He grants it generously to those who ask, as seen in Solomon’s example.
Recognize and appreciate God’s blessings in your life, using them to glorify Him and serve others faithfully.
Value godly counsel and the testimony of others who have witnessed God’s work, just as the queen of Sheba confirmed Solomon’s wisdom firsthand.
Commit to faithful stewardship of the resources and responsibilities God has entrusted to you, following Solomon’s example of wise and just leadership.

keyVerses.text: Happy are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the blessing of being close to godly wisdom and leadership, encouraging believers to seek and cherish wise counsel.

keyVerses.text: Blessed be the LORD thy God, which delighted in thee to set thee on his throne, to be king for the LORD thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made he thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores that Solomon’s kingship was ordained by God to promote justice and righteousness, reminding believers of God’s sovereign purpose in leadership.

keyVerses.text: And king Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms the unparalleled blessing of wisdom and wealth given by God to Solomon, illustrating the supreme value of divine wisdom.

keyVerses.text: And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
keyVerses.significance: This verse marks the duration of Solomon’s reign, emphasizing the stability and prosperity under his God-ordained leadership.
